docs.snippet: The U.S. House of Representatives on Tuesday overwhelmingly passed a $10.9 billion extension of U.S. transportation funding through May 2015, a measure aimed at averting cutbacks in August in federal money for road, bridge and transit projects....

headline.main: U.S. House Passes $10.9 Billion Transportation Funding Extension
headline.print_headline: U.S. House Passes $10.9 Billion Transportation Funding Extension

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. House of Representatives on Tuesday overwhelmingly passed a $10.9 billion extension of U.S. transportation funding through May 2015, a measure aimed at averting cutbacks in August in federal money for road, bridge and transit projects.

docs.snippet: China's economy grew slightly faster than expected in the second quarter as a burst of government stimulus paid dividends, but analysts said further support was likely to be needed to meet the government's growth target for 2014....

headline.main: China Growth Picks Up as Stimulus Pays Off
headline.print_headline: China Growth Picks Up as Stimulus Pays Off

docs.lead_paragraph: China's economy grew slightly faster than expected in the second quarter as a burst of government stimulus paid dividends, but analysts said further support was likely to be needed to meet the government's growth target for 2014.

docs.snippet: China's shadow banking firms slashed lending to property developers in the first half of this year, closing off a crucial funding avenue just as the housing market cools, potentially spelling trouble for the sector and the broader economy....

headline.main: Chinese Property Developers at Risk as Trust Funds Dry Up
headline.print_headline: Chinese Property Developers at Risk as Trust Funds Dry Up

docs.lead_paragraph: China's shadow banking firms slashed lending to property developers in the first half of this year, closing off a crucial funding avenue just as the housing market cools, potentially spelling trouble for the sector and the broader economy.

docs.snippet: CNBC’s Josh Lipton spoke with Timothy D. Cook, Apple’s chief, and his counterpart at IBM, Virginia M. Rometty about the new partnership between the two companies....

headline.main: Apple and IBM Team Up on Business Apps
headline.sub: Cook: Partnership the best of Apple, best of IBM

docs.lead_paragraph: CNBC’s Josh Lipton spoke with Timothy D. Cook, Apple’s chief, and his counterpart at IBM, Virginia M. Rometty about the new partnership between the two companies.

docs.snippet: The ex-wife of a police officer who left the department after a report tied him to the Ku Klux Klan told investigators that the couple joined the group as part of an undercover operation, according to a report released Tuesday by the Florida Depar...

headline.main: Ex-Wife: Police Officer Joined KKK Undercover
headline.print_headline: Ex-Wife: Police Officer Joined KKK Undercover

docs.lead_paragraph: The ex-wife of a police officer who left the department after a report tied him to the Ku Klux Klan told investigators that the couple joined the group as part of an undercover operation, according to a report released Tuesday by the Florida Department of Law Enforcement.

docs.snippet: A federal appeals court panel ruled Tuesday that the University of Texas can continue using race as a factor in undergraduate admissions as a way of promoting diversity on campus, the latest in an ongoing case that made it to the U.S. Supreme Cour...

headline.main: Appeals Court: Texas Can Use Race in Admissions
headline.print_headline: Appeals Court: Texas Can Use Race in Admissions

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court panel ruled Tuesday that the University of Texas can continue using race as a factor in undergraduate admissions as a way of promoting diversity on campus, the latest in an ongoing case that made it to the U.S. Supreme Court last year only to be sent back to lower courts for further review.

docs.snippet: CSX Corp. (CSX) said Tuesday its second-quarter profit chugged ahead 2 percent as the economy continued to improve, so the railroad is investing an additional $100 million in its network....

headline.main: CSX Railroad's 2Q Profit Chugs Ahead 2 Percent
headline.print_headline: CSX Railroad's 2Q Profit Chugs Ahead 2 Percent

docs.lead_paragraph: CSX Corp. (CSX) said Tuesday its second-quarter profit chugged ahead 2 percent as the economy continued to improve, so the railroad is investing an additional $100 million in its network.

docs.abstract: An alternative to the Whitney Biennial in Arkansas focuses on contemporary artists and “the evolving narratives that make up our cultural fabric.”
